Title: Serial investment fraudster bags 63 years in Ibadan
Summary: Serial investment fraudster bags 63 years in Ibadan . Olaniyan Gbenga Amos sentenced to 63 years’ jail term for multiple investment fraud . He was convicted alongside his firm, Detorrid .

Title: Olukoyede decries rampant breach of contract rules in MDAs
Summary: Ola Olukoyede raised concern over disregard for due process across Nigeria’s Ministries, Departments and Agencies . Warning that non-compliance with financial regulations is fuelling systemic corruption .

Title: No Permit, No Hajj: Saudi Interior Ministry issues stern warning to intending pilgrims
Summary: Saudi Ministry of Interior has stressed that no one will be allowed to perform Hajj without a valid permit . In a statement released on 28th April 2025, the ministry warned that strict penalties will be applied to pilgrims .

Title: EBRD opens Lagos office as Nigeria deepens EU ties
Summary: EBRD opens Lagos office as Nigeria deepens EU ties with EU . The European Bank for Reconstruction and Development (EBRD) is opening its first West African office in Lagos . Nigeria's economic diplomacy received a major boost on Tuesday .

Title: Malaria: Delta distributes 3.182 million insecticide-treated mosquito nets
Summary: Delta State Government has commenced the distribution of 3.182 million insecticide-treated nets (ITNs) The state Ministry of Health Programme Manager for Malaria, Dr. Julie Aniah, announced this yesterday .

Title: Alleged money laundering: EFCC produces Aisha Achimugu in court
Summary: The operatives of the Economic and Financial Crimes Commission arrived at the Federal High Court in Abuja with the businesswoman, Aisha Achimugu, on Wednesday, as ordered by the court . The EFCC operatives arrived in court at about 11:35 am . Justice Justice Justice Ogunlesi, who was in attendance, said Achim

Title: Heal Nigeria’s divides, rebuild your country together – Anglican Primate counsels youths
Summary: The Primate of the Church of Nigeria, Most Revd. Dr. Henry Ndukuba, urged Nigerian youths to rise above insecurity, economic hardship, and national disunity . Addressing over 20,000 attendees at the 2025 Joshua Generation .

Title: US threatens to quit Russia-Ukraine effort unless ‘concrete proposals’
Summary: The president suggested on Tuesday that his Russian counterpart Vladimir Putin still wants to negotiate a peace agreement with Ukraine . The US threatens to quit Russia-Ukraine effort unless ‘concrete proposals’ appeared .

Title: Police arrest eight suspects over cult-related killings in Lagos
Summary: Hundeyin said, "Investigation is still in progress to unravel the full extent of the suspects' involvement in cult-related activities" The suspects will be made to face the full wrath of the law, he said .

Title: We’ll Welcome Ibori to APC – Oborevwori
Summary: Delta State Governor, Rt. Hon. Sheriff Oborevwori, expressed optimism that they would welcome former Governor James Ibori to the All Progressives Congress, APC . Speaking during a vigil mass in honour of the former Deputy Governor of the state, Professor Amos Utuama, at St. Andrew’s

Title: Kano okays over N51bn for capital projects to boost infrastructure
Summary: The Kano State Executive Council has approved an unprecedented N51.5 billion for critical infrastructure and public service delivery projects across the state . This was revealed in a statement issued by the governor’s spokesman, Sunusi Dawakin-Tofa following the 27th Executive Council meeting held on Tuesday, 28th April 2025 .

Title: Enugu LP secretary, ex-commissioner defect to PDP
Summary: Mr. Titus Odo, the Publicity Secretary of the Labour Party in Enugu State, on Wednesday defected to the People’s Democratic Party . Odo defected alongside the former Commissioner for Chieftaincy Affairs in the state, Prince Emeka Mamah, who was the State Coordinator of the Peter Obi Presidential Campaign

Title: Police arrest eight suspects linked to cult-related killings in Lagos
Summary: The Lagos State Police Command has arrested eight individuals in connection with a series of cult-related killings . The arrests were made on April 29, 2025, following an intelligence-led operation . The suspects are believed to be linked to violent cult activities .

Title: NAFDAC unveils tools to check fake drugs in N'East
Summary: The National Agency for Food and Drug Administration and Control has launched innovative mobile technologies aimed at combating counterfeit drugs in Nigeria’s North-East region . The “Scan 2 Verify” and “Green Book App” tools are designed to authenticate medicines and ensure public safety . Participants from various healthcare sectors were introduced to the

Title: Nigerian schools must integrate AI into curriculum – Expert
Summary: A data and AI expert, Abel Aboh, has urged the Nigerian government to embed artificial intelligence education into school curricula from nursery level upwards . Aboh argued that introducing AI and digital skills early in life is no longer optional but essential . He stressed that schools without internet or computer access are no longer viable in today’s world
